abstract_summ: Inoculation of respiratory samples into human airway epithelial cells, Vero E6 and Huh7 cell lines, led to the isolation of a novel respiratory virus whose genome analysis showed it to be a novel coronavirus related to SARS-CoV, and therefore named severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).A novel coronavirus “SARS-CoV-2” (and the disease COVID-19) emerged suddenly, causing a rapid outbreak with a moderate case fatality rate.The causative agent of the outbreak was identified by the WHO as the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus-2 (SARS-CoV-2), producing the disease named coronavirus disease-2019 (COVID-19).The Coronavirus (CoV) is a large family of viruses known to cause illnesses ranging from the common cold to acute respiratory tract infection.On January 7, 2020, the causative agent was identified as a new coronavirus (2019-nCoV), and the disease was later named as COVID-19 by the WHO.
title_summ: Novel Coronavirus (nCoV): a Bitter Old Enemy in a New AvatarEl SARS-CoV-2, una nueva zoonosis pandémica que amenaza al mundoEmergence of Novel Coronavirus and COVID-19: whether to stay or die out?Global Spread of Coronavirus Disease 2019 and Malaria: An Epidemiological Paradox in the Early Stage of A PandemicThe COVID-19 Pandemic: A Comprehensive Review of Taxonomy, Genetics, Epidemiology, Diagnosis, Treatment, and ControlThe SARS-CoV-2, a new pandemic zoonosis that threatens the worldCombating the Coronavirus Pandemic: Early Detection, Medical Treatment, and a Concerted Effort by the Global CommunityCOVID-19 Outbreak: An OverviewMysterious Virus: A Review on Behavior and Treatment Approaches of the Novel Coronavirus, 2019-nCoVCOVID-19: Emergence, Spread, Possible Treatments, and Global BurdenNovel coronavirus and central nervous system.COVID-19: A Worldwide, Zoonotic, Pandemic Outbreak.A Review of the Disease, the Virus, and Public Health Measures.COVID-19-A Novel Zoonotic Disease:
title_abstract_phrases: Inoculation of respiratory samples into human airway epithelial cells, Vero E6 and Huh7 cell lines, led to the isolation of a novel respiratory virus whose genome analysis showed it to be a novel coronavirus related to SARS-CoV, and therefore named severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).A novel influenza virus created the first pandemic of the 21st century, the pandemic flu in 2009 preceded with the emergence of another deadly virus, MERS-CoV in 2012.The causative agent of the outbreak was identified by the WHO as the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus-2 (SARS-CoV-2), producing the disease named coronavirus disease-2019 (COVID-19).Novel coronavirus and central nervous system.SUMMARY: A few days later, the genome of a novel coronavirus was released (http://virological.org/t/novel-2019-coronavirus-genome/319; Wuhan-Hu-1, GenBank accession No. MN908947) and made publicly available to the scientific community.
